  • My CV
I was born and raised in Tianjin, China. The people of the Tianjin City have quite an reputation for their senses of humor and casual living attitudes among Chinese people. And as someone who grew up there, I totally endorse such statement.
In 2011, I got admitted into Hohai University and started my career in water engineering ever since. After completed my B.E. in Agricultural Water Conservancy Engineering in 2015, I went to UC Irvine to continue my study in Hydrology & Water Resources as a Master student. I spent two wonderful years in California and happily graguated in 2017. After I got my Masters, I got back to my home contry and wored the CRAES in Beijing for a short period of time.
In 2019, I came back to the States to pursue my PhD under the supervision of Dr. Tiantian Yang at OU. My PhD reserch are currently focusing on Subseaon to Seasonal (S2S) scale precipitation and hydrologic forecasts.
